intro: Labordia tinifolia var. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai lantana, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in coastal habitats and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
